quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
author: Cory House

quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson

quote: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
author: Grady Booch

quote: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
author: Thomas Fuchs

quote: The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language.
author: Alan Kay

quote: There are only two hard things in computer science: cache invalidation and naming things.
author: Phil Karlton

quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

quote: Give someone a program, you frustrate them for a day; teach them how to program, you frustrate them for a lifetime.
author: David Leinweber

quote: It's not a bug, it's an undocumented feature!
author: Anonymous

quote: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Alan Kay

quote: Programming is the art of telling another human what one wants the computer to do.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday's code.
author: Dan Salomon

quote: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
author: Austin Freeman

quote: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it’s too late.
author: Seymour Cray

quote: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
author: Chris Pine

quote: The sooner you start to code, the longer the program will take.
author: Roy Carlson

quote: The best code is no code at all.
author: Jeff Atwood

quote: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
author: Patrick McKenzie

quote: Programming is thinking, not typing.
author: Casey Patton

quote: The art of debugging is figuring out what you really told your program to do rather than what you thought you told it to do.
author: Andrew Singer

quote: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

quote: If debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
author: Edsger Dijkstra

quote: Software is like sex: it's better when it's free.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
author: Patrick McKenzie

quote: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
author: Chris Pine

quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: Don't write better error messages, write code that doesn't need them.
author: Jason C. McDonald

quote: Good code is its own best documentation. As you're about to add a comment, ask yourself, 'How can I improve the code so that this comment isn't needed?'
author: Steve McConnell

quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
author: Cory House

quote: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: John Woods

quote: There are two ways to write error-free programs; only the third one works.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: The best way to get accurate information on programming is to write a blog post about it.
author: Cory House

quote: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
author: Patrick McKenzie

quote: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.
author: Anonymous

quote: Real programmers can write assembly code in any language.
author: Larry Wall

quote: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson

quote: Programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty text file.
author: Louis Srygley

quote: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

quote: There are only two kinds of programming languages: those people always bitch about and those nobody uses.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quote: If at first you don't succeed, call it version 1.0.
author: Anonymous

quote: A SQL query walks into a bar, walks up to two tables and asks...
author: Anonymous

quote: If you think math is hard, try web design.
author: Trish Parr

quote: Java is to JavaScript what car is to Carpet.
author: Chris Heilmann

quote: There are only 10 types of people in the world: those who understand binary, and those who don't.
author: Anonymous

quote: Hardware: the parts of a computer that can be kicked.
author: Jeff Pesis

quote: Programming is like sex: one mistake and you’re providing support for a lifetime.
author: Michael Sinz

quote: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V. Berard

quote: I'm not a great programmer; I'm just a good programmer with great habits.
author: Kent Beck

quote: In order to understand recursion, one must first understand recursion.
author: Anonymous

quote: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
author: Dennis Ritchie

quote: The difference between a bad programmer and a good programmer is not how many programming languages they know, and it's not whether they prefer Python or Java. It's whether they can communicate their ideas.
author: Anonymous

quote: The code you write makes you a programmer. The code you delete makes you a good one. The code you don't have to write makes you a great one.
author: Mario Fusco

quote: If you automate a mess, you get an automated mess.
author: Rod Michael

quote: Don't write code to solve a problem. Write code to define a problem. The code is the easy part; it's the definition that's hard.
author: Larry Wall

quote: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
author: Bill Gates

quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: One of my most productive days was throwing away 1,000 lines of code.
author: Ken Thompson

quote: A language that doesn't affect the way you think about programming is not worth knowing.
author: Alan Perlis

quote: The only way to go fast is to go well.
author: Robert C. Martin

quote: Software is a gas; it expands to fill its container.
author: Nathan Myhrvold

quote: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
author: Thomas Fuchs

quote: One man's crappy software is another man's full-time job.
author: Jessica Gaston

quote: The sooner you start to code, the longer the program will take.
author: Roy Carlson

quote: Premature optimization is the root of all evil.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: If you think good architecture is expensive, try bad architecture.
author: Brian Foote and Joseph Yoder

quote: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
author: Patrick McKenzie

quote: A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
author: Doug Linder

quote: It's okay to figure out murder mysteries, but you shouldn't need to figure out code. You should be able to read it.
author: Steve McConnell

quote: The purpose of software engineering is to control complexity, not to create it.
author: Pamela Zave

quote: A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it.
author: Albert Einstein
